column4: hi, i run a sh script with sudo, and during the install, it says 'you're local user not superuser so you can do nothing. Bye' ; what can i do?
try 'sudo -i' and then call your script
no, 'sudo -i' <enter>, then call the script as root.
how do i exit the 'root login' on the console?
it doesnt work ; when i execute a bin, i still get 'permission denied'...

sudo: please use single character options
2006-02-19T12:27:00.000Z	soundray	oonoon	sudo -s
2006-02-19T12:28:00.000Z	oonoon	soundray	tsss, neither
2006-02-19T12:29:00.000Z	soundray	oonoon	you could enable root temporarily with 'sudo passwd', then 'su -'.
2006-02-19T12:29:00.000Z	oonoon	soundray	i ll try this one
2006-02-19T12:30:00.000Z	soundray	oonoon	recommend disabling root afterwards with 'sudo passwd -l'
2006-02-19T12:30:00.000Z	oonoon	soundray	ok ok thanks
2006-02-19T12:40:00.000Z	soundray	oonoon	'su -'
2006-02-19T12:41:00.000Z	oonoon	soundray	damn, it still sees me as local user
2006-02-19T12:42:00.000Z	soundray	oonoon	what is this script?
2006-02-19T12:42:00.000Z	oonoon	soundray	matlab install
2006-02-19T12:42:00.000Z	soundray	oonoon	is this graphical?
2006-02-19T12:43:00.000Z	oonoon	soundray	no graphical
2006-02-19T12:44:00.000Z	soundray	oonoon	see if the wiki instructions work.
